title: Define Project Requirements
description: Gather and document the functional and non-functional requirements for the GlobalDistributedFileSystem. This includes performance, scalability, security, fault-tolerance, interoperability, and any other relevant requirements. The focus should also be on identifying the key performance indicators (KPIs) that will help measure the system's effectiveness.

title: Design the System Architecture
description: Create a high-level design for the GlobalDistributedFileSystem architecture, including components, communication patterns, and interfaces.

title: Develop Core System Components
description: Implement the core components of the GlobalDistributedFileSystem, including client interfaces, metadata management, data storage, and fault tolerance mechanisms.

title: Implement Scaling Mechanisms
description: Develop scalability and load-balancing strategies for the GlobalDistributedFileSystem to handle global data storage needs.

title: Create User Interfaces and APIs
description: Design and develop user interfaces for various client applications as well as RESTful APIs for integration.

title: Implement Database Schema and Store
description: Design the database schema for storing metadata and file data, as well as implementing the associated data store.

title: Set Up Continuous Integration and Deployment Pipelines
description: Create CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment process for the GlobalDistributedFileSystem.

title: Perform Functional and Performance Testing
description: Execute a series of functional, integration, and performance tests to validate the GlobalDistributedFileSystem.
dependencies: Set Up Continuous Integration and Deployment Pipelines

title: Resolve Test Findings and Iterate
description: Address the identified issues or areas for improvement based on testing results and re-test until acceptable performance levels are reached.

title: Document System Design and Functionality
description: Create comprehensive technical documentation detailing the design, architecture, and functionality of the GlobalDistributedFileSystem. This includes explaining data consistency mechanisms (such as Consistent Hashing, Raft Protocol), scalability aspects, fault-tolerance strategies (like Replication Factor and Erasure Coding), performance considerations (like throughput, latency, and capacity planning), potential trade-offs for each approach, concrete examples where possible to improve understanding, and a section dedicated to security implications. Provide clear headings, bullet points, and diagrams to aid readability.
